snippet: Loaded with treasure, the S.S. Central America sank in 1857 during a hurricane near South Carolina. After years of legal battles, a private company is finally excavating the ship.
abstract: Odyssey Marine Exploration begins excavation of SS Central America, ship that sank off coast of South Carolina in 1857 while carrying vast trove of gold; effort by private company follows decades of legal battles between claimants, insurers and investors who say they were duped by Thomas G Thompson, man who discovered ship in 1988; businessman Ira O Kane has been appointed to recover as much gold as possible.
lead_paragraph: Loaded with treasure, the S.S. Central America sank in 1857 during a hurricane near South Carolina. After years of legal battles, a private company is finally excavating the ship.

headline.main: X Still Marks Sunken Spot, and Gold Awaits
headline.print_headline: X Still Marks Sunken Spot; Gold Awaits
